roleset.name: to modify the manner or appearance, to conceal

example.name: transitive
example.text: [Appropriations committees]-1 have used an assortment of devices [*-1] to disguise as much as $ 1 billion [*U*] in spending , and as critics have awakened to these devices , the bill can seem like a wounded caribou trying [*] to make it past ice and wolves [*-3] to reach safer winter grazing .
example.arg: as much as $ 1 billion [*U*] in spending

example.name: passive
example.text: The jury found them guilty of conspiracy in [*] obtaining the payments , some of which-3 [*T*-3]-1 were disguised [*-1] as fees for consulting services from Mrs. Garcia .
example.arg: as fees for consulting services from Mrs. Garcia

predicate.note: Frames file for 'disguise' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus.
